html:
10.30.24  9:46 am   I'm autistic, but I have a not autistic friend and they told me that you do not always answer in a straight forward way in your answers. Sometimes you say the opposite of the answer you really mean. I would ask if this is true, but I would have no idea if the answer you give is the true or the opposite of what is true. Apparently people don't always just say direct answers to questions and I don't understand why. Apparently that is autism, but it seems more to me like everyone else is the weird one for not just answering questions directly. And if everyone else knows that you can never know if someone is answering a question directly and honestly, how does anyone function?

      perhaps the problem is that total complete honesty would take an infinite amount of time to express. to answer finitely, requires an absurd amount of simplifation, and the answerer may have to make some big decisions about how to go about doing that. in some cases it may turn out that stronger meaning can be approximated better by going at sort of an oblique angle from the question, especially if there are other important issues that weren't even covered in the question. For example, let's say there is a Tsunami approaching. your friend asks you "what's 2 plus 2". and instead of saying "4", you answer "aaaaah there's a Tsunami approaching"

10.30.24  8:46 am   what's spookier? halloween or the day before/after halloween

      after

10.30.24  5:51 am   how long have you been answering questions for 

      a little while

10.30.24  1:14 am   Dangling participles, Yea or Nay?

      never heard of it

10.30.24  12:54 am   i think many would say your lyrics are abstract; rhythmic elements designed to support the music you're writing. but do any of your lyrics have a clear meaning you're trying to communicate? in particular, i can't shake the feeling that there's a story to follow in "When I Get Older."

      i try to use the full range of the abstract--concrete spectrum. maybe that's different from the usage you're used to, but i don't favor either end of the spectrum per se. need the whole spectrum in fact, to reach the level of nourishment i crave

10.29.24  11:26 pm   why do wind turbines use three blades and steam turbines use 100. It drives me crazy

      it's possible that the inventor of the steam turbine was driven crazy by how few blades the wind turbines had

10.29.24  10:47 pm   How do I get as good as you at subverting expectations?

      pretty much all you have to do is be alive. stunningly simple

10.29.24  10:15 pm   bill, would you say everybody likes a joke? 

      no, that's not what i would say

10.29.24  10:07 pm   do treadmills get sad they can't travel anywhere?

      no, but sometimes the person using them does

10.29.24  9:52 pm   do we have free will 

      everyone has free will EXCEPT immediately after watching a robert sapolsky video, at which point they are momentarily unable to resist asking everyone around if they have free will

10.29.24  9:32 pm   is salad dressing when you get dressed up in salad?

      no

10.29.24  8:54 pm   thanks, bill. how do you feel about statements in your question box, rather than questions?

      fine

10.29.24  5:36 pm   Opinions on floors?

      they always seem too high or too low

10.29.24  5:02 pm   is 1/1 just 2/2, or are they different people, maybe friends, or enemies? do you think theres something happening there? where does 5/5 go when 1/1 gets subtracted by itself? maybe this is all a bit too heavy for you

      too light actually, i'm sorry to say

10.29.24  4:30 pm   how do you refer to song ideas on your song ideas list? is it by title?  what if the thing in question doesn't have a title yet?

      if nothing else, by date/time

10.29.24  4:12 pm   When the bagels give their mating call, why do the forlorn children of our world answer with violence 

      remind me again what forlorn means, i've never heard that word used in real life

10.29.24  3:39 pm   should i learn to tune my piano myself, or should i hire a professional? 

      if you learn to tune a piano then everyone is gonna ask you to tune their piano. you'll become a professional piano tuner and you'll get way too rich too fast

10.29.24  2:02 pm   would you like to learn about toki pona, the language with only 120 words? 

      sure. tell me how many combinations of words there are

10.29.24  1:50 pm   Are there any questions you wish you could answer on this page, that you don't for whatever reason?

      now that you mention it, sometimes i wish for whatever reason

10.29.24  1:38 pm   What languages can you speak?

      i secretly can speak dutch, but i haven't admitted it to myself yet. also i don't know if this counts, but i sometimes say 'burger king' in a french accent

10.29.24  1:06 pm   different time signatures don't really make sense to me so i just count everything in 1. is there a good reason to not do it that way? 

      i mean.......... some people can't tell the difference between an eye and a nose. but that's probably not really a choice, it's just how they are. but they can still live a vibrant and fruitful life

10.29.24  11:46 am   Got any neat tricks for web design

      actually being there

10.29.24  11:42 am   why u alway uses lowercase letters

      maybe it's time to take a cold hard look in the mirror and ask yourself that

10.29.24  11:09 am   have you ever been on a ground plane? havent been on one myself but it sounds exciting

      the exciting thing is you can get where you're going without even having to accomplish any of the impossible

10.29.24  10:38 am   less of a question more of an observation, you answer questions like a magic 8 ball, why is that.

      maybe it's because when some people eat a real apple, they assume it tastes like a plastic apple, just because they've seen so many plastic apples before. kind of unfair to the real apple, who turns out to be very sensitive about this

10.29.24  9:57 am   in 'at the airport terminal', the "shwzshwzshwz" bit seems like the planes are trying to tell us something. any ideas on what they're trying to say?

      they are trying to say precisely this

10.29.24  9:53 am   it's my first year in college. you seem like the sort of guy good at finding a passion and sticking with it. how do i do that with my major decision 

      the passions find me and they grab me mercilessly for an extended period of time. there's nothing i can really do about it, nor can i particularly control the timing. to make this even more useless for you, i have never chosen a college major

10.29.24  7:44 am   I want to pursue philosophy as a hobby, but how do I do this? What do I do with what I've learned?

      basically the key to philosophy is dressing up like a thoughtful person. strangely convenient that you ask this just in time for halloween

10.29.24  5:34 am   thoughts on people who come to this page without a question but type something in here anyway

      they are lovely, resourceful people

10.29.24  4:29 am   why is the moon round

      to remind you of the sun

10.29.24  3:50 am   how does one catch worthwhile ideas and where to catch them in the first place?

      they can be caught anywhere, and they can be caught using any storable/recordable method of communication you're comfortable with. including but not limited to writing or recording

10.29.24  1:57 am   does this train have a destination?

      some trains go in a circle

10.29.24  1:35 am   Why do I worry I will do bad things that I know I won't do?

      maybe you're restless because you haven't done enough thinking about the good stuff you'd like to do

10.29.24  1:15 am   you ever forget you're already you, like you don't have to be anyone to be you?

      i don't forget that, but i perhaps forget other things

10.29.24  12:47 am   How do I stop watching your videos? I watched one now I cant stop watching them.

      i can't help you

10.28.24  10:27 pm   As someone from Connecticut, I ask why you chose to write a song about New Canaan?

      perhaps it was the 'aa' that appealed to me

10.28.24  8:29 pm   how does one write an emoticon inside parentheses? for example, (smiley face :))

      you may have to resort to words here

10.28.24  7:58 pm   Thoughts on fashion? 

      could happen

10.28.24  5:39 pm   What is your opinion on "What is your opinion on opinions" questions?

      that's one of the first questions people ask when they don't have a question

10.28.24  4:41 pm   is being annoying funny

      technically no

10.28.24  2:32 pm   how do I make a sundae

      according to what i've been told, you order everything on the desert menu and throw it in a pile

10.28.24  11:38 am   advice for big penguins? 

      no, i assume they are doing fine

10.28.24  9:20 am   whats something you have to always keep in mind?

      probably not good to keep any one thing in mind 100% of the time. it's actually essential to have things leave and then return to mind

10.28.24  8:33 am   WHen did all the windmills start to turn so slow?

      beginning of the week maybe

10.28.24  7:37 am   Have you ever looked at the stars in the sky and thought about how cool it is that you/we exist?

      i think a lot generally about how cool it is to exist, but when i look at the stars i usually think more about the cool existence of the stars

10.28.24  5:40 am   why is south charleston, wv called south charleston when it's northwest of charleston, wv?

      it's a trick of the river. it's south of the river, while the regular charleston is north of the river

10.28.24  3:56 am   i just watched a yt video by a creator i like and found out some pretty cool stuff about them. i also learned some stuff while they revealed said cool stuff, and think that i might have been influenced for the better. tell me, have you ever been influenced for the better after discovering stuff related to a creator you like?

      that can happen as a result of interacting in any way with anyone

10.28.24  3:32 am   will we ever find out about things you made that we don't currently know you made?

      surely

10.28.24  3:08 am   favorite time signature?

      regular

10.28.24  2:48 am   Have you heard of toki pona, the language with only 120 words? 

      i've seen the posters
